item.title: Overgrown weeds & grass everywhere corner of honeyden road, 19th June
item.description:
Resident reporting there is overgrown weeds & grass on the pavement and on the roads it is everywhere and eyesore, it used to be sprayed with a weed killer but now only someone came out to strim a bit of the grass across the road now and again but in front of the corner bungalow and on the pavement the weeds have grown out of control and looking like a jungle. Please could someone come with a strimmer and weed killer please if possible
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): North Cray Road, North Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Report 7705276, 19th June
item.description:
This is the third time that I have reported litter in the close. Twice I have received notices to say that the problem has been fixed. I don't know if the street cleaner needs to go to specsavers, needs to look for another job or is just plain lazy. There is litter all around the close that has not been collected.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Palewell Close, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Major pedestrian crossing is dangerous and not fit for purpose, 19th June
item.description:
The pedestrian crossing on Clerkenwell Road serves commuters to and from Farringdon Station, it is a very busy crossing and it is dangerous. 1. Routinely, cars emerging and turning left from Farringdon Lane go through the red light. It happens so often it is evidently an easy and grave mistake to make. Drivers are looking right to traffic on the busy Clerkenwell Rd and not seeing or reacting to the red light on the crossing just a few metres away. 2. The crossing lights are routinely abused by cyclists, most prevalently electric bikes speeding through red lights and the groups of people trying to cross the road. 3. Cars and buses stop in traffic straddling the crossing, making it dangerous for pedestrians to cross when the green man is active. They do this because there is a yellow box junction just ahead and they want to encroach as much as they can. 4.The crossing interval permissions for pedestrians are too infrequent, meaning masses of people gather on the pavement and it is difficult to walk right from Turnmill Street into Clerkenwell Road. Please take a good look at this crossing, it is not fit to be located where it is and something needs to change to prevent accidents.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 63, Clerkenwell Road, Clerkenwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sewer Smell, 19th June
item.description:
The whole corner block from the bus stop, through all the houses and down to the park absolutely stinks of raw sewerage from the storm drain. It's an unbearable smell of faeces meaning we are having to close our windows and doors despite it being so hot
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Sanford Walk, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked storm drain (again), 19th June
item.description:
Blocked storm drain in Limes Avenue on the corner with Woodside Grove. Affected drain is located close to a mature lime tree (see pic taken earlier this month). I would also like to point out that this drain frequently gets blocked and has been subject to previous unblock requests, the most recent being last October (ref 11076786). This suggests there is an underlying problem with this drain requiring a detailed examination if this can be arranged please.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Limes Avenue, Woodside Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet
